eligibilityTitle: Check if you can apply online
title: Unable to proceed
defaultHeader: Sorry, you can’t use the online service
deathCertificateHeader: You need the death certificate or an interim death certificate
deathCertificateTranslationHeader: You need to get the death certificate translated into English
eeEstateValuedHeader: Find out if you need to report the estate value to HMRC
inheritanceHeader: You need to check if there’s any Inheritance Tax to pay
notOriginalHeader: You need the original will and any codicils
applyByPostHeader: You cannot apply for probate online
cannotApplyByOnlineHeader: You cannot apply for probate online
personCannotApplyByOnlineHeader: This person is not entitled to apply
postHeader: You must apply for probate by post
deathCertificate: You must get the original death certificate or an interim death certificate (opens in a new tab) from the coroner before you apply for probate.
deathCertificateTranslation: You must get the foreign death certificate translated into English (opens in a new tab) before you apply for probate.
notInEnglandOrWales:
If the person who died didn’t live in England or Wales or intend to return here, you can’t apply for probate online.

If the person who died:

  • left a will, fill in Form PA1P (opens in a new tab).
  • did not leave a will, fill in Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).
ihtNotCompleted: You must work out the value of the estate and pay any Inheritance Tax before you apply for probate. You do this with HMRC (opens in a new tab).
eeEstateNotValued: You can use the Inheritance Tax checker (opens in a new tab) to find out if you need to report the value of the estate to HMRC.
notDiedAfterOctober2014:
If the person died before 1 October 2014, You can’t apply for probate online

Fill in Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).
notRelated:
As your relationship to the person who died is not listed, you cannot use the online service to apply for probate.

You may still be able to apply for probate by post. Check if you are the most entitled person to apply (opens in a new tab) before you start.

If you are the most entitled person, you can use Form PA1A to apply by post (opens in a new tab).
otherApplicants:
If you want to make a joint application, you can’t apply for probate online.

Fill in Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).
notOriginal:
If the will was made with a solicitor, the original may be held at their office. If the firm of solicitors that drew up the original are no longer in existence you’ll need to contact the Solicitors Regulation Authority (opens in a new tab) to search their records as they may now hold the original will and codicils.

Find the original will (opens in a new tab).

If you don’t have the original will and any codicils

You can’t apply for probate online.

If the person who died:
  • left a will but you do not have the original, fill in Form PA1P (opens in a new tab).
  • did not leave a will, fill in Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).
notExecutor:
If you’re not named as an executor or if you’re applying on behalf of someone else, you can’t apply for probate online.

Fill in Form PA1P (opens in a new tab).
mentalCapacity:
If an executor is not able to make their own decisions, you can’t apply for probate online.

Fill in Form PA1P (opens in a new tab) and Form PA14: Medical Certificate (opens in a new tab).
divorcePlace:
As you have told us that {deceasedName} got divorced or ended their civil partnership outside of England and Wales, you cannot apply for probate online.

You should apply by post using Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).
separationPlace:
As you have told us that {deceasedName} got legally separated outside of England and Wales, you cannot apply for probate online.

You should apply by post using Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).
otherRelationship:
You can’t use the online service if you’re not the spouse, civil partner or the child of the person who died.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).
adoptionNotEnglandOrWales:
You cannot use the online service if the adoption took place outside of England and Wales.

You may still be able to apply in some situations, but we will need to ask you for more information.

You should apply by post using Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).
adoptedOut:
You cannot use the online service if you were adopted out of the family.

You may still be able to apply in some situations, but we will need to ask you for more information.

You should apply by post using Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).
spouseNotApplying:
As you have told us that {deceasedName}’s husband, wife or civil partner is not giving up their right to apply, you cannot use the online service.

You should use the inheritance checker (opens in a new tab) to work out if you can make a joint application or if {deceasedName}’s husband, wife or civil partner must apply by themselves.

If you are still entitled to make an application, you can apply by post using Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).
childrenUnder18:
You cannot use the online service if there are children under the age of 18 who will receive part of the estate.

You should apply by post using Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).
grandchildrenUnder18:
You cannot use the online service if there are children under the age of 18 who will receive part of the estate.

You should apply by post using Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).
deceasedHadLegalPartnerAndRelationshipOt:
As you have told us that {deceasedName} was married or in a civil partnership, you are not the most entitled person to apply for probate.

{deceasedName}'s husband, wife or civil partner is the most entitled to apply. They must make their own application online or by post using Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).

If they do not want to apply, they can:

  • give up their right to apply using Form PA16 (opens in a new tab) - this will allow a child of {deceasedName} to apply instead
  • appoint someone else to apply on their behalf using Form PA12 (opens in a new tab)
You are not entitled to apply
deceasedNoLegalPartnerAndRelationshipOth:
As your relationship to {deceasedName} is not listed, you cannot use the online service to apply for probate.

You may still be able to apply for probate by post. Check if you are the most entitled person to apply (opens in a new tab) before you start.

If you are the most entitled person, you can use Form PA1A to apply by post (opens in a new tab).
You cannot apply for probate online
otherCoApplicantRelationship:
Based on the information you have given us, you cannot apply with this person as they are not entitled to apply for probate.

You can use the inheritance checker (opens in a new tab) to work out who else is entitled to apply.

If you want to apply by yourself or with someone else, you can go back and change your answers.

Return to application
coApplicantAdoptionPlaceStop:
You cannot use the online service if the adoption took place outside of England and Wales.

{applicantName} may still be able to apply in some situations, but we will need to ask you for more information.

If you still want to apply with {applicantName}, you should apply by post using Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).

If you want to apply by yourself or with someone else, you can go back and change your answers.

Return to application
coApplicantAdoptedOutStop:
You cannot use the online service if {applicantName}’s parent was adopted out of the family.

{applicantName} may still be able to apply in some situations, but we will need to ask you for more information.

If you still want to apply with {applicantName}, you should apply by post using Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).

If you want to apply by yourself or with someone else, you can go back and change your answers.

Return to application
coApplicantParentAdoptedOutStop:
You cannot use the online service if {applicantName}’s parent was adopted out of the family.

{applicantName} may still be able to apply in some situations, but we will need to ask you for more information.

If you still want to apply with {applicantName}, you should apply by post using Form PA1A (opens in a new tab).

If you want to apply by yourself or with someone else, you can go back and change your answers.

Return to application
